get.description: Suggests examples that would improve the accuracy of the intent model.

200.description: If there's no trained model, nothing is returned in the response. If there's a trained model and the active learning algorithm finds any relevant queries, they are returned with the model predictions. If there's a trained model but the active learning algorithm didn't find any relevant queries, an empty list is returned in the response.

parameters.description: The target entity extractor model to enhance.

200.description: If there's no trained model, nothing is returned in the response. If there's a trained model and the active learning algorithm finds any relevant queries, they are returned with the model predictions. If there's a trained model but the active learning algorithm didn't find any relevant queries, an empty list is returned in the response.

post.description: Sends a training request for a version of a specified LUIS app. This POST request initiates a request asynchronously. To determine whether the training request is successful, submit a GET request to get training status. Note: The application version is not fully trained unless all the models (intents and entities) are trained successfully or are up to date. To verify training success, get the training status at least once after training is complete.

202.description: This response indicates the initial training status.

get.description: Gets the training status of all models (intents and entities) for the specified LUIS app. You must call the train API to train the LUIS app before you call this API to get training status. "appID" specifies the LUIS app ID. "versionId" specifies the version number of the LUIS app. For example, "0.1".

200.description: A successful response provides an array of training status details for a LUIS app that you submitted for training. Each element in the response array provides training status for a model (intent or entity) in the LUIS app. Note: Training status is not provided for prebuilt entities because they are pretrained. The "modelId" property identifies which intent or entity the training status corresponds to. To get the name and type of each model, use the models API which has a request URL in this format: https://westus.api.cognitive.microsoft.com/luis/api/v2.0/apps/{appId}/versions/{versionId}/models The details property for each model can contain the following fields: "statusId": An integer from 0 to 3 that corresponds to the value of the status field. "status": A string with one of the following values: "Success", "UpToDate", "InProgress", "Fail". If the status is "Fail", the "failureReason" property provides the reason for failure. "exampleCount": The number of examples used for training. In the case of the None intent or prebuilt domain intents and entities, this number includes example provided internally by the system as well as examples you added to your LUIS app. "failureReason": A string that indicates the reason training failed.  The value "FewLabels" means that no labeled examples were provided for training. "trainingDateTime": A string indicating the time the model was last trained. The value uses the ISO 8601 format for representing times in UTC (Coordinated Universal Time) with a UTC designator ("Z"), for example: "2017-08-10T01:08:34Z".

EntityLabelObject.description: Defines the entity type and position of the extracted entity within the example.

startCharIndex.description: The index within the utterance where the extracted entity starts.

endCharIndex.description: The index within the utterance where the extracted entity ends.

ApplicationCreateObject.description: Properties for creating a new LUIS Application

culture.description: The culture for the new application. It is the language that your app understands and speaks. E.g.: "en-us". Note: the culture cannot be changed after the app is created.

domain.description: The domain for the new application. Optional. E.g.: Comics.

description.description: Description of the new application. Optional.

initialVersionId.description: The initial version ID. Optional. Default value is: "0.1"

usageScenario.description: Defines the scenario for the new application. Optional. E.g.: IoT.

name.description: The name for the new application.

PrebuiltDomainCreateBaseObject.description: A model object containing the name of the custom prebuilt entity and the name of the domain to which this model belongs.

PrebuiltDomainCreateObject.description: A prebuilt domain create object containing the name and culture of the domain.

culture.description: The culture of the new domain.

PrebuiltDomainModelCreateObject.description: A model object containing the name of the custom prebuilt intent or entity and the name of the domain to which this model belongs.

modelName.description: The intent name or entity name.

JSONEntity.description: Exported Model - Extracted Entity from utterance.

startPos.description: The index within the utterance where the extracted entity starts.

endPos.description: The index within the utterance where the extracted entity ends.

ApplicationSettingUpdateObject.description: Object model for updating an application's settings.

public.description: Setting your application as public allows other people to use your application's endpoint using their own keys.

PublishSettingUpdateObject.description: Object model for updating an application's publish settings.

sentimentAnalysis.description: Setting sentiment analysis as true returns the Sentiment of the input utterance along with the response

speech.description: Setting speech as public enables speech priming in your app

spellChecker.description: Setting spell checker as public enables spell checking the input utterance.

entityLabels.description: The identified entities within the utterance.

intentName.description: The identified intent representing the utterance.

PhraselistCreateObject.description: Object model for creating a phraselist model.

phrases.description: List of comma-separated phrases that represent the Phraselist.

isExchangeable.description: An exchangeable phrase list feature are serves as single feature to the LUIS underlying training algorithm. It is used as a lexicon lookup feature where its value is 1 if the lexicon contains a given word or 0 if it doesn’t. Think of an exchangeable as a synonyms list. A non-exchangeable phrase list feature has all the phrases in the list serve as separate features to the underlying training algorithm. So, if you your phrase list feature contains 5 phrases, they will be mapped to 5 separate features. You can think of the non-exchangeable phrase list feature as an additional bag of words that you are willing to add to LUIS existing vocabulary features. Think of a non-exchangeable as set of different words. Default value is true.

SubClosedList.description: Sublist of items for a Closed list.

canonicalForm.description: The standard form that the list represents.

SubClosedListResponse.description: Sublist of items for a Closed list.

ApplicationUpdateObject.description: Object model for updating the name or description of an application.

PrebuiltExtractorNames.description: Object model for adding a prebuilt entity to the application.

activated.description: Indicates if the Pattern feature is enabled.

PatternUpdateObject.description: Object model for updating an existing Pattern feature.

isActive.description: Indicates if the Pattern feature is enabled.

name.description: Name of the closed list feature.

ClosedListModelPatchObject.description: Object model for adding a batch of sublists to an existing closedlist.

activated.description: Indicates if the feature is enabled.

words.description: List of comma-separated phrases that represent the Phraselist.

mode.description: An exchangeable phrase list feature are serves as single feature to the LUIS underlying training algorithm. It is used as a lexicon lookup feature where its value is 1 if the lexicon contains a given word or 0 if it doesn’t. Think of an exchangeable as a synonyms list. A non-exchangeable phrase list feature has all the phrases in the list serve as separate features to the underlying training algorithm. So, if you your phrase list feature contains 5 phrases, they will be mapped to 5 separate features. You can think of the non-exchangeable phrase list feature as an additional bag of words that you are willing to add to LUIS existing vocabulary features. Think of a non-exchangeable as set of different words. Default value is true.

ModelCreateObject.description: Object model for creating a new entity extractor.

name.description: Name of the new entity extractor.

PatternCreateObject.description: Object model for creating a Pattern feature.

WordListObject.description: Sublist of items for a Closed list.

canonicalForm.description: The standard form that the list represents.

WordListBaseUpdateObject.description: Object model for updating one of the closed list's sublists.

canonicalForm.description: The standard form that the list represents.

JSONUtterance.description: Exported Model - Utterance that was used to train the model.

ClosedListModelUpdateObject.description: Object model for updating a closed list.

subLists.description: The new sublists for the feature.

name.description: The new name of the closed list feature.

ClosedListModelCreateObject.description: Object model for creating a closed list.

name.description: Name of the closed list feature.

ExampleLabelObjectArray.description: Object model for adding a batch of labeled examples.

VersionInfo.description: Object model of an application version.

lastTrainedDateTime.description: Timestamp of the last time the model was trained.

endpointUrl.description: The Runtime endpoint URL for this model version.

intentsCount.description: Number of intents in this model.

entitiesCount.description: Number of entities in this model.

endpointHitsCount.description: Number of calls made to this endpoint.

TaskUpdateObject.description: Object model for cloning an application's version.

version.description: The new version for the cloned model.

PhraselistUpdateObject.description: Object model for updating a Phraselist.

phrases.description: List of comma-separated phrases that represent the Phraselist.

isActive.description: Indicates if the Phraselist is enabled.

isExchangeable.description: An exchangeable phrase list feature are serves as single feature to the LUIS underlying training algorithm. It is used as a lexicon lookup feature where its value is 1 if the lexicon contains a given word or 0 if it doesn’t. Think of an exchangeable as a synonyms list. A non-exchangeable phrase list feature has all the phrases in the list serve as separate features to the underlying training algorithm. So, if you your phrase list feature contains 5 phrases, they will be mapped to 5 separate features. You can think of the non-exchangeable phrase list feature as an additional bag of words that you are willing to add to LUIS existing vocabulary features. Think of a non-exchangeable as set of different words. Default value is true.

ApplicationPublishObject.description: Object model for publishing a specific application version.

isStaging.description: Indicates if the staging slot should be used, instead of the Production one.

LuisApp.description: Exported Model - An exported LUIS Application.

versionId.description: The version ID of the application that was exported.

FeatureIDResponse.description: The ID of the created feature.

LabeledUtterances.description: A list of predictions and label pairs for every example in the application.

text.description: The utterance. E.g.: what's the weather like in seattle?
The utterance. E.g.: what's the weather like in seattle?
The utterance. E.g.: what's the weather like in seattle?

startTokenIndex.description: The index within the utterance where the extracted entity starts.

endTokenIndex.description: The index within the utterance where the extracted entity ends.

score.description: The intent's score, based on the prediction model.

startTokenIndex.description: The index within the utterance where the extracted entity starts.

endTokenIndex.description: The index within the utterance where the extracted entity ends.

phrase.description: The actual token(s) that comprise the entity.

id.description: A six-digit ID used for Features.

isActive.description: Indicates if the feature is enabled.

isExchangeable.description: An exchangeable phrase list feature are serves as single feature to the LUIS underlying training algorithm. It is used as a lexicon lookup feature where its value is 1 if the lexicon contains a given word or 0 if it doesn’t. Think of an exchangeable as a synonyms list. A non-exchangeable phrase list feature has all the phrases in the list serve as separate features to the underlying training algorithm. So, if you your phrase list feature contains 5 phrases, they will be mapped to 5 separate features. You can think of the non-exchangeable phrase list feature as an additional bag of words that you are willing to add to LUIS existing vocabulary features. Think of a non-exchangeable as set of different words. Default value is true.
